RIOCIGUAT

Indications and doses

Chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension that is recurrent or persistent following surgery, or is inoperable (initiated under specialist supervision), Monotherapy or in combination with an endothelin receptor antagonist for idiopathic or hereditary pulmonary arterial hypertension, or pulmonary arterial hypertension associated with connective tissue disease (initiated under specialist supervision),

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 1 mg 3 times a day for 2 weeks, increased in steps of 0.5 mg 3 times a day, dose to be increased every 2 weeks, increased to up to 2.5 mg 3 times a day, increase up to maximum dose only if systolic blood pressure ≥ 95 mmHg and no signs of hypotension, if treatment interrupted for 3 or more days, restart at 1 mg three times daily for 2 weeks and titrate as before, during titration, reduce dose by 0.5 mg three times daily if systolic blood pressure falls below 95 mmHg and patient shows signs of hypotension.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Avoid—toxicity in animal studies.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Titrate dose cautiously in moderate impairment.

Manufacturer advises avoid in severe impairment—no information available.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Titrate dose cautiously—risk of hypotension.

Manufacturer advises avoid if eGFR less than 30 mL/minute/1.73 m2—limited information available.

Contra indications

  • History of serious haemoptysis
  • previous bronchial artery embolisation
  • pulmonary veno-occlusive disease

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Anaemia, constipation, diarrhoea, dizziness, dyspepsia, dysphagia, epistaxis, gastritis, gastro-oesophageal reflux, haemoptysis, headache, hypotension, nasal congestion, nausea, palpitation, peripheral oedema, vomiting,

uncommon: Pulmonary haemorrhage,

Advice for patients and carers

Smoking cessation advised (response possibly reduced). Patients should inform prescriber if smoking started or stopped during treatment; dose adjustment may be necessary.

National funding/access decisions

Cautions regarding administration

  • Autonomic dysfunction
  • elderly (risk of hypotension)
  • hypotension (do not initiate if systolic blood pressure below 95 mmHg)
  • hypovolaemia
  • severe left ventricular outflow obstruction

  • Smoking cessation advised (response possibly reduced); dose adjustment may be necessary if smoking started or stopped during treatment.

Advice regarding conception and contraception

Effective contraception required during treatment.

Monthly pregnancy tests advised.

Prepared medicinal forms of RIOCIGUAT

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.
